alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sumter County through 745 PM EDT... At 718 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Croxton Crossroads, or 9 miles southwest of Americus, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Plains, Leslie, De Soto, Desoto, Cobb, Sumter, Lamar, Maddox, Croxton Crossroads and Huntington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
